awards.title: CHEMOFLAZE
awards.description:
● Industrial Use of used Polyester Terepthalate (PET) bottles/ other PET waste. 

►PET is used as a raw material for making packaging materials such as bottles and containers for packaging a wide range of food products and other consumer goods. Examples include soft drinks, alcoholic beverages, pharmaceutical products and edible oils.We proposed glycolysis of PET which will convert it into bis 2-hydroxyethylterephthalate(BHET) which can be reused for polymerization process

projects.title: Development of Novel catalyst for non-oxidative Dehydro-aromatization of Methane gas into liquid fuels.
projects.description:
•	The parent catalysts 5%Mo/HZSM-5 having SAR-30 & 55 has been prepared by co-precipitation method. By wet impregnation method, I introduced 0.3% Sn (Tin) as promoter to enhance aromatic selectivity and catalyst stability.
•	Conducted characterization of catalysts using BET &TPR to determine surface area and reduction temperature of Molybdenum oxides respectively.
•	Pretreatment with hydrogen at 350oC was done to transform HCP structure of MoCxOy  into FCC to enhance catalyst activity. After pretreatment, CH4 gas was passed at 973K to produce MoCx active species.
•	Conducted calibration of FID (Flame ion Detector) and TCD (Thermal conductivity detector) using standard mixture of gases and calculated Response factors for each component relative to nitrogen. 
•	Conducted reactions with each catalyst in Fixed Bed Reactor at 700oC and atmospheric pressure maintaining H2/CH4 ratio equal to 0.25.
•	Plans to do TGA analysis of spent catalyst to obtain amount of coke produced by analyzing percentage lost in weight.
•	The mathematical analysis of products obtained is being carried out using internal standard method

contributors.headline: Cost Engineer | Low Carbon Solution  | Hydrogen Reformer| Ethylene Furnace | Carbon Capture

projects.title: Development of novel catalyst for converting Synthesis gas (CO + H2) into liquid fuels by Fischer-Tropsch Process
projects.description:
•	The co-precipitation method was used to prepare silica based bimetallic 10%Fe/20%Co/SiO2 catalysts. The Tetraethyl Orthosilicate (TEOS) was used as silica precursor solution.
•	The different weight percentages (0.05%, 0.1%, 0.3%, 0.5%) Ruthenium (Ru) salts were introduced in  10%Fe/20%Co/SiO2 catalysts by wet impregnation method.
•	Conducted BET ( Brunauer-Emmett-Teller) analysis to determine surface area ,pore volume and TPR(Temperature Programmed Reduction)  analysis to determine  reduction temperature. The peaks obtained were compared to reason effect of ruthenium on reduction temperature of metal oxides (CoO & Co3O4 ) present in catalyst.
•	Conducted calibration of FID (Flame Ion Detector) and TCD (Thermal Conductivity Detector) using standard mixture of gases and calculated Relative Response Factor for each component taking nitrogen as inert component. 
•	Conducted reactions at 220oC and 20 Bar in Fixed Bed Reactor with H2/CO molar ratio equal to 1 .The nitrogen was also employed with reacting gases as inert internal standard for mathematical calculations.
•	Conducted product distribution analysis by injecting certain volume of product stream in Gas chromatograph (FID &TCD). 
•	The mathematical analysis of product side was done using internal standard method to determine effect of ruthenium concentration on catalyst stability, CO conversion, carbon deposition and C5+ hydrocarbons selectivity.

contributors.headline: Cost Engineer | Low Carbon Solution  | Hydrogen Reformer| Ethylene Furnace | Carbon Capture

projects.title: Industrial Visit:Jubilant & Teva API Industries and Reliance Industries Limited
projects.description: The Industrial visits helped me gain the knowledge regarding the operating methods of industries and I got chance to actually see the working of various equipments like pressure vessels, valves, distillation columns, boilers, filters, dryers, detailed framework of piping systems and also about the control systems used. This acquainted me with the operations of various processes involved in a process industry.

contributors.headline: Cost Engineer | Low Carbon Solution  | Hydrogen Reformer| Ethylene Furnace | Carbon Capture

projects.title: Plant Design: HDPE
projects.description:
• The process used in manufacturing of HDPE (400TPD) was Zieglar process due to low operating pressure and greater flexibility in product properties. The materials used were ethylene gas, cyclohexane and zieglar natta catalyst.
• The process details and specific assumptions were provided to carry out material and energy balances.
• The Capacity of the process design was calculated on industry specified targets and assumptions. For heat transfer balance it was kept in mind to make sure given design is able to remove heat more than generated in chemical reaction. Assumed values Shell side coefficient and overall heat transfer coefficient were verified by reverse calculations.
• The structural design specifications of reactor, torrispherical head, extruder, support, agitator were calculated using equipment design mathematical relations and applying appropriate assumptions.
• Details concerned with instrumentation, safety and hazards, geographical plant layout were also explained. Basic plant economics was also performed to prove feasibility of results obtained.

contributors.headline: Cost Engineer | Low Carbon Solution  | Hydrogen Reformer| Ethylene Furnace | Carbon Capture

projects.title: Qualitative and Quantitative study of CHLOR-ALKALI plant
projects.description:
• The qualitative study was done on CHLOR-ALKALI production unit which included electrolytic cell        ,chlorine storage ,evaporators functioning.
• In addition to this quantitative analysis was also performed on electrolytic cell, evaporators, condensers running in the plant by applying basic fundamentals of process calculations and knowledge of NaOH preparation chemical reaction.
• The basics of safety and necessary steps required in situation of any accident were also taught.

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for the preparation of accurate and consistent cost estimates for proposals in accordance with the customer’s commercial requirements in the tender phase. 
•	Developed Monte Carlo Probabilistic Cost Model for Proprietary Equipment. 
•	Responsible for tracking and maintaining estimate scope changes.
•	Present commercial information for management approval meetings.
•	Collaborate with other office across globe to prepare estimates. 
•	Assist in the maintenance of our database for cost estimates. 
•	Develop and maintain a library of cost estimates, use historical data and prepare benchmarks.
•	Work closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to identify and analyze cost drivers and discuss commercial mitigation strategies.
•	Review and analyze project specifications and drawings to identify cost risks and opportunities.
•	Work with project teams to develop value engineering and cost-saving solutions.
profile_positions.title: Cost Engineer

profile_positions.description: Estimating| Applied Statistics | Project Management | Contract Management | Scheduling | Cost Management & Controls | Risk Management | Value Engineering | Leadership | Presentation | Reporting | Communication | Case Study | Written Exams | Technical Paper Thesis
profile_positions.title: Certified Cost Engineer

profile_positions.description:
●The project aims at understanding transport mechanism(translocation) of DNA molecules into loading Giant Vesicles prepared from electroswelling. T
●  Devising protocol for DNA translocation and performing quantification of DNA uptake from MATLAB programming on raw images obtained from Confocal Microscopy.
●  Theoretical DNA Translocation models were checked with MATLAB programming.
● Learning about state of art laboratory equipment, biophysics, polymer science , electroporation, fluorescence microscopy.
profile_positions.title: M.Sc Thesis-Delivering DNA molecules into Giant  Unilamllar Vesicles through Electroporation

profile_positions.description:
●   Developed Probabilistic and Deterministic Life Cycle Costing (LCC) Model.

●   Created detailed cost elements sheet for process industry from initial capital to abandonment.

●   Developed  Monte- Carlo Simulation Model (VBA) for Failure data  to obtain Failure Maintenance Expenditure.

●   Performed Sensitivity analysis to determine significance of cost elements from @Risk 7.5 .
 
●   Used Markov Chain Model for RAM(Reliability, Availability and Maintainability)  analysis of process equipment. 

●  learned RAM(Reliability, availability and maintainability) analysis, RCA(Root cause analysis), FMEA, asset management, CAPEX, and OPEX.

●  Described model application on Iso-Butane Production unit.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Internship-Development of LCC(Life Cycle Costing) Model.

profile_positions.description:
● The aim of project was to design an integrated solar to methanol plant operational in daylight with output capacity of  1000 MT per day. 
● Acquired hands on experience with Aspen Plus Software to optimize process, MATLAB for 
    Modelling CO2 capture, gained knowledge about HAZOP, PFDs , unit specifications sheets,P & IDs.
● The deliverables of project included -
       ►The energy required for the process  was provided from solar panels and usage of heat 
        integration during process .
  ►The CO2 was captured for syngas production from hollow fiber membranes.
  ► The  Solar energy powered  Electrochemical Cells were used to convert captured CO2 into syn-gas and additional  hydrogen production unit of water decomposition was also used to maximize methanol production by maintaining CO and H2 ratio.
  ►The classical reactor was used to produce methanol from synthesis gas.
  ► The project was found to be technically feasibile but required colossal CAPEX and OPEX costs.
profile_positions.title: Design of Large Scale Solar Fuel Plant
